availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Sarah J. Perkins. Farther of Joseph S. Perkins, James Perkins, John Perkins, Spottswood Perkins, Frances Perkins, Benjamin J. Perkins, Eliza J. Perkins, and Wesley H. Perkins. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 60B.
